errors.error_description: The `jq` command in the git commit example is missing quotes around the JSON key, causing a syntax error.
The README incorrectly states that all data must be placed in a central `/data/hpi` directory, which is not a default and will cause modules to fail to find the data.
correction_candidates: Remove the sentence 'By default, all modules expect your data to be located in the `/data/hpi` directory, so make sure to place it there.' Data paths are configured per-module.
Change the directory from `/data/hpi` to `~/hpi_data` as that is the correct default.
Add instructions to create the `/data/hpi` directory with `sudo mkdir -p /data/hpi && sudo chown $USER /data/hpi`.
The data path should be set using an environment variable: `export HPI_DATA_PATH=/data/hpi`.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'By default, all modules expect your data to be located in the `/data/hpi` directory, so make sure to place it there.' Data paths are configured per-module.
